{"step_by_step_thinking": "The facial nerve lies in the temporal bone and exits the skull through the stylomastoid foramen. As we read from 'Anatomy of the Facial Nerve', the course of the facial nerve from its origin in the human brain-stem to the termination of its end fibers in the muscles of facial expression is reviewed in detail, including the relation of the facial nerve to important adjacent structures.", "answer_choice": "C"}
